question_text: The ratio of male to female students in a college for five years is plotted in the following line graph. If the number of female students doubled in 2009, by what percent did the number of male students increase in 2009?
subject: General Aptitude
diagram_mermaid_code:
xychart-beta
    title "Ratio of male to female students"
    x-axis "Year" [2008, 2009, 2010, 2011, 2012]
    y-axis "Ratio" 0 --> 3.5
    line [2.5, 3.0, 2.2, 1.0, 1.6]

question_text:
Consider the directed graph given below.

Which one of the following is TRUE?
options: (A) The graph does not have any topological ordering.
(B) Both PQRS and SRQP are topological orderings.
(C) Both PSRQ and SPRQ are topological orderings.
(D) PSRQ is the only topological ordering.
subject: Algorithms
correct_answer: (C) Both PSRQ and SPRQ are topological orderings.
diagram_mermaid_code:
graph TD
    P --> Q
    P --> R
    R --> S
    Q --> S

question_text:
Consider the finite automaton in the following figure.

What is the set of reachable states for the input string 0011?
subject: Theory of Computation
diagram_mermaid_code:
graph LR
    style q0 fill:#fff,stroke:#333
    style q1 fill:#fff,stroke:#333
    style q2 fill:#fff,stroke:#333
    style q3 fill:#fff,stroke:#333
    q0((q0)) -- 0,1 --> q1((q1))
    q1 -- 1 --> q1
    q1 -- 0,1 --> q2((q2))
    q2 -- 0,1 --> q3((q3))
    q3 -- 1 --> q3

options: (A) The producer will be able to add an item to the buffer, but the consumer can never consume it.
(B) The consumer will remove no more than one item from the buffer.
(C) Deadlock occurs if the consumer succeeds in acquiring semaphore s when the buffer is empty.
(D) The starting value for the semaphore n must be 1 and not 0 for deadlock-free operation.
subject: Operating System
correct_answer: (C) Deadlock occurs if the consumer succeeds in acquiring semaphore s when the buffer is empty.
diagram_mermaid_code:
graph TD
    subgraph Producer
        direction TB
        P1(produce) --> P2(semWait(s))
        P2 --> P3(addToBuffer)
        P3 --> P4(semSignal(s))
        P4 --> P5(semSignal(n))
        P5 --> P1
    end
    subgraph Consumer
        direction TB
        C1(semWait(n)) --> C2(semWait(s))
        C2 --> C3(removeFromBuffer)
        C3 --> C4(semSignal(s))
        C4 --> C5(consume)
        C5 --> C1
    end

question_text:
Three processes A, B and C each execute a loop of 100 iterations. In each iteration of the loop, a process performs a single computation that requires tc CPU milliseconds and then initiates a single I/O operation that lasts for tio milliseconds. It is assumed that the computer where the processes execute has sufficient number of I/O devices and the OS of the computer assigns different I/O devices to each process. Also, the scheduling overhead of the OS is negligible. The processes have the following characteristics:

Process id    tc          tio
A             100 ms      500 ms
B             350 ms      500 ms
C             200 ms      500 ms

The processes A, B, and C are started at times 0, 5 and 10 milliseconds respectively, in a pure time sharing system (round robin scheduling) that uses a time slice of 50 milliseconds. The time in milliseconds at which process C would complete its first I/O operation is ____________.
subject: Operating System
diagram_mermaid_code:
graph TD
    subgraph Process_Characteristics
        A["Process A (tc=100ms, tio=500ms)"]
        B["Process B (tc=350ms, tio=500ms)"]
        C["Process C (tc=200ms, tio=500ms)"]
    end

question_text:
Which of the regular expressions given below represent the following DFA?

I)   0*1(1+00*1)*
II)  0*1*11*0*1
III) (0+1)*1
subject: Theory of Computation
diagram_mermaid_code:
graph LR
    subgraph DFA
        S2((S2))
        S1((S1))
        direction LR
        entry --> S1
        S1 -- 0 --> S1
        S1 -- 1 --> S2
        S2 -- 0 --> S1
        S2 -- 1 --> S2
    end

question_text: Suppose a polynomial time algorithm is discovered that correctly computes the largest clique in a given graph. In this scenario, which one of the following represents the correct Venn diagram of the complexity classes P, NP and NP Complete (NPC)?
subject: Theory of Computation

question_text:
Consider the 4-to-1 multiplexer with two select lines S₁ and S₀ given below.

The minimal sum-of-products form of the Boolean expression for the output F of the multiplexer is
subject: Digital Logic
diagram_mermaid_code:
graph TD
    subgraph Multiplexer_Circuit
        direction LR
        i0["Input 0 (0)"] --> mux{"4-to-1 MUX"}
        i1["Input 1 (I)"] --> mux
        i2["Input 2 (R)"] --> mux
        i3["Input 3 (R')"] --> mux
        s1["Select S1 (P)"] -.-> mux
        s0["Select S0 (Q)"] -.-> mux
        mux --> F["Output F"]
    end
